name: puppetlabs-acl
summary: This module provides the ability to manace ACLs on nodes
author: puppetlabs
description: This module provides the ability to manace ACLs on nodes. Currently the only operating system supported is Windows

properties.name: permissions
properties.doc:
Permissions is an array containing Access Control Entries
      (ACEs). Certain Operating Systems require these ACEs to be in
      explicit order (Windows).

properties.name: owner
properties.doc:
The owner identity is also known as a trustee or principal
      that is said to own the particular acl/security descriptor. This
      can be in the form of: 1. User - e.g. 'Bob' or 'TheNetBob',
      2. Group e.g. 'Administrators' or 'BUILTINAdministrators', 3.
      SID (Security ID) e.g. 'S-1-5-18'. Defaults to 'S-1-5-32-544' (Administrators).

properties.name: inherit_parent_permissions
properties.doc:
Inherit Parent Permissions specifies whether to inherit
      permissions from parent ACLs or not. The default is true.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc:
The name of the acl resource. Used for uniqueness. Will set
      to the target if target is unset.

parameters.name: target
parameters.doc:
The location the acl resource is pointing to. In the first
      release of ACL, this will be a file system location.
      The default is the name.

parameters.name: target_type
parameters.doc:
The type of target for the Acl resource. In the first release
      of ACL, only :file is allowed. Defaults to :file.

parameters.name: purge
parameters.doc:
Purge specifies whether to remove other explicit permissions
      if not specified in the permissions set. This doesn't do anything
      with permissions inherited from parents. The default is false.

types.name: acl
types.doc:
Manages access control lists.  The `acl` type is typically
    used when you need more complex management of permissions
    e.g. Windows.

      ADD HERE LATER
